title: AssertionError in _http1 after multiple calls
body:
#### Problem Description
I used mitmproxy to create an automatic upstream proxy switcher that based on the whether a certain host is available will use a specific upstream proxy, and otherwise it will route the traffic through a second instance of mitmproxy that functions just as a direct proxy (because you can only change upstream proxies, not switch from upstream proxy to direct connection).

Because of a new way of distributing my switcher solution, I now have a hard dependency on python 3.12 and therefore needed to upgrade from the mitmproxy 9.0.0 I was using (and was working perfectly) to a recent version. Therefore did an upgrade to mitmproxy 10.3.1

With mitmproxy 10.3.1, I started seeing assertion errors every now and then:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\server.py", line 380, in server_event
    for command in layer_commands:
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layer.py", line 157, in handle_event
    command = command_generator.send(send)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layer.py", line 270, in handle_event
    yield from self._handle(event)
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layer.py", line 157, in handle_event
    command = command_generator.send(send)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\__init__.py", line 880, in _handle_event
    yield from self.event_to_child(stream, event)
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\__init__.py", line 961, in event_to_child
    yield from self.get_connection(command)
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\__init__.py", line 1003, in get_connection
    yield from self.event_to_child(
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\__init__.py", line 957, in event_to_child
    yield from self.event_to_child(conn, command.event)
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\__init__.py", line 936, in event_to_child
    for command in child.handle_event(event):
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layer.py", line 157, in handle_event
    command = command_generator.send(send)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\tunnel.py", line 98, in _handle_event
    yield from self.event_to_child(event)
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\tunnel.py", line 153, in event_to_child
    for command in self.child_layer.handle_event(event):
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layer.py", line 157, in handle_event
    command = command_generator.send(send)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layer.py", line 157, in handle_event
    command = command_generator.send(send)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\_http1.py", line 71, in _handle_event
    yield from self.send(event)
  File "c:\Users\Guido\switcher_venv\Lib\site-packages\mitmproxy\proxy\layers\http\_http1.py", line 353, in send
    assert self.stream_id == event.stream_id
AssertionError
```

I have narrowed it down to something that changed between 10.1.6 (which does NOT show this error) and 10.2.0 (which started to introduce this error)

#### Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. start mitmweb with the following command `mitmweb --no-web-open-browser --listen-host 127.0.0.1 -p 7070`
2. Start an ubuntu container:
  - Windows / mac with podman desktop:  `podman run -it --rm -e http_proxy=http://host.containers.internal:7070 -e https_proxy=http://host.containers.internal:7070 ubuntu bash`
  - Windows / mac with docker desktop: `docker run -it --rm -e http_proxy=http://host.docker.internal:7070 -e https_proxy=http://host.docker.internal:7070 ubuntu bash`
  - Linux: `docker run -it --rm --net=host -e http_proxy=http://localhost:7070 -e https_proxy=http://localhost:7070 ubuntu bash`
3. Run apt-get update in the container

After about 9 connections, all of a sudden I get the above mentioned assertion error. However, apt-get probably does a retry, and eventually it finishes.

Ran into this problem on my windows machine first. But the same happens on my linux machine with the above steps:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/942dbce4-89e3-42d1-bade-851e40c5598f)




#### System Information
Mitmproxy: 10.3.1
Python:    3.12.0
OpenSSL:   OpenSSL 3.2.2 4 Jun 2024
Platform:  Windows-10-10.0.19045-SP0
